title: Young Woman with a Water Pitcher
creator: Johannes Vermeer
description: A well-known painting by Vermeer, featuring a young woman filling a pitcher, embodying the artist's mastery of light and shadow.

title: Sadaksari-Lokeshvara Surrounded by Manifestations and Monks
creator: Tibet
description: A depiction of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara, surrounded by monks and various manifestations, representing compassion and divine presence.

title: Abiding nowhere, the awakened mind arises
creator: Musō Soseki
description: A conceptually significant phrase from Buddhist teachings, symbolizing the liberation of the mind from attachment.

title: The Penitence of Saint Jerome
creator: Albrecht Dürer
description: A portrayal of Saint Jerome in deep penance, reflecting on his spiritual struggles and devotion.

title: Finches and Bamboo
creator: Emperor Huizong
description: A beautiful depiction of finches perched on bamboo, showcasing the harmony of nature in traditional Asian art.

title: The Horse Fair
creator: Rosa Bonheur
description: A famous piece by Bonheur, showcasing a bustling horse market with her keen attention to detail and motion.

title: Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara (1541–1609)
creator: El Greco (Domenikos Theotokopoulos)
description: A portrait of Cardinal Fernando Niño de Guevara, highlighting his dignified and regal bearing.

title: Comtesse de la Châtre (Marie Charlotte Louise Perrette Aglaé Bontemps, 1762–1848)
creator: Elisabeth Louise Vigée Le Brun
description: A detailed portrait of Comtesse de la Châtre, capturing the elegance of the French aristocracy.

title: Clothing the Naked
creator: Michiel Sweerts
description: An evocative piece representing the theme of modesty, juxtaposing nudity with the act of covering.

title: The Thomas Hunt and the America
creator: James Bard
description: A piece reflecting the historical exploration and the early American experience.

title: The Abduction of Rebecca
creator: John Everett Millais
description: An iconic scene from Sir Walter Scott’s novel, depicting the dramatic moment of Rebecca’s abduction.

title: The Holy Family with the Young Saint John the Baptist
creator: Raphael
description: A serene portrayal of the Holy Family with the young Saint John the Baptist, displaying Raphael’s idealized beauty.

title: Virgin and Child with Saint Anne
creator: Leonardo da Vinci
description: An intimate and powerful depiction of the Virgin and Child with Saint Anne, demonstrating Leonardo’s mastery of emotion and detail.

title: Broken Eggs
creator: Jean-Baptiste Greuze
description: A still life painting depicting broken eggs, symbolizing fragility and impermanence.

title: A Stallion
creator: George Stubbs
description: A majestic and highly detailed portrait of a stallion, showcasing Stubbs’ renowned equine painting skills.

title: Tommaso di Folco Portinari (1428–1501); Maria Portinari (Maria Maddalena Baroncelli, born 1456)
creator: Hans Memling
description: A Renaissance portrait of Tommaso di Folco Portinari and his wife Maria, illustrating their status and piety.

title: Young Husband: First Marketing
creator: Lilly Martin Spencer
description: An early 20th-century piece depicting the life of a young husband engaged in business or commerce.

title: The Lovers
creator: René Magritte
description: A surrealist painting by Magritte, featuring two lovers with their heads obscured, evoking themes of love and separation.

title: Portrait of a Young Man
creator: Raphael
description: A striking portrait by Raphael, showcasing his ability to capture personality and grace.

title: The Concourse of the Birds, Folio 11r from a Mantiq al-Tayr (Language of the Birds)
creator: Attar of Nishapur
description: A beautifully illustrated manuscript page depicting birds representing spiritual journeys, drawn from the Persian classic.

title: The Harvesters
creator: Pieter Bruegel the Elder
description: A vivid depiction of rural life, showing peasants harvesting crops in the height of summer, filled with detailed landscape and figures.

title: Rubens, Helena Fourment (1614–1673), and Their Son Frans (1633–1678)
creator: Peter Paul Rubens
description: A loving family portrait by Rubens, capturing his wife Helena Fourment and their son in a moment of familial tenderness.

title: The Third-Class Carriage
creator: Honoré Daumier
description: A social commentary by Daumier, illustrating the hardships of lower-class passengers in the third-class railway carriage.

title: The Abduction of the Sabine Women
creator: Jacques-Louis David
description: A neoclassical portrayal of the dramatic moment when Roman men abducted the Sabine women to secure their future in Rome.

title: Venus and Adonis
creator: Peter Paul Rubens
description: A vibrant, sensual depiction by Rubens of the mythological lovers Venus and Adonis, filled with emotion and beauty.

title: The Rest on the Flight into Egypt
creator: Georges de La Tour
description: A serene and intimate depiction of the Holy Family resting during their flight into Egypt, illuminated by soft candlelight.

title: The Annunciation
creator: Leonardo da Vinci
description: A masterpiece by da Vinci, capturing the moment of the Annunciation with delicate attention to the figures and light.

title: Francesco d'Este (born ca. 1429, died after 1486)
creator: Rogier van der Weyden
description: A portrait of Francesco d'Este, likely commissioned to reflect the noble stature and power of the subject.

title: Hayne Hudjihini, Eagle of Delight
creator: Henry Inman
description: A symbolic portrait of Hayne Hudjihini, a Native American leader, representing strength and spiritual connection to nature.

title: Portrait of a Carthusian
creator: Petrus Christus
description: A quiet and reflective portrait of a Carthusian monk, embodying the order's commitment to solitude and contemplation.

title: Thousand-Armed Chenresi, a Cosmic Form of the Bodhisattva Avalokiteshvara
creator: Tibet
description: A mesmerizing representation of Chenresi, the bodhisattva of compassion, with a thousand arms, symbolizing boundless mercy.

title: Heart of the Andes
creator: Frederic Edwin Church
description: A grand and romantic landscape painting depicting the Andes mountains, showcasing Church's mastery of natural detail and light.

title: Antoine Laurent Lavoisier (1743–1794) and Marie Anne Lavoisier (Marie Anne Pierrette Paulze, 1758–1836)
creator: Jacques-Louis David
description: A famous portrait of the French chemist Antoine Lavoisier and his wife Marie Anne, depicting them in the midst of scientific discovery.

title: Portrait of the Indian Monk Atisha
creator: Tibet
description: A dignified portrait of the Indian monk Atisha, a key figure in the spread of Buddhism to Tibet.

title: Venus and Cupid
creator: Peter Paul Rubens
description: A sensuous and playful depiction of the love between Venus and her son Cupid, filled with rich colors and movement.

title: Juan de Pareja (ca. 1608–1670)
creator: Diego Velázquez
description: A powerful portrait by Velázquez of his servant Juan de Pareja, capturing the humanity and dignity of the subject.

title: Manuel Osorio Manrique de Zuñiga (1784–1792)
creator: Francisco de Goya
description: A formal portrait of a young Spanish aristocrat, Manuel Osorio, by Goya, showcasing the innocence and vulnerability of childhood.

title: Rama Releases the Demon Spies Shuka and Sarana: Folio from the Siege of Lanka series
creator: Manaku
description: An illustration from the Ramayana epic, depicting the heroic figure of Rama freeing the demon spies.

title: The Last Communion of Saint Jerome
creator: Caravaggio
description: A dramatic and emotional scene showing Saint Jerome at the moment of his last communion, painted with Caravaggio's signature realism.

title: Joan of Arc
creator: Sir John Everett Millais
description: A poignant portrayal of the French heroine Joan of Arc, captured in a moment of intense spiritual devotion.

title: Self-Portrait with Two Pupils, Marie Gabrielle Capet (1761–1818) and Marie Marguerite Carraux de Rosemond (1765–1788)
creator: Adélaïde Labille-Guiard
description: A self-portrait by the artist with two of her pupils, reflecting the role of women in the art world during the French Revolution.

title: The Kangxi Emperor's Southern Inspection Tour, Scroll Three: Ji'nan to Mount Tai
creator: Wang Hui
description: A monumental scroll painting depicting the Emperor's Southern Inspection Tour, showcasing the grandeur and power of the Qing dynasty.

title: Bridge over a Pond of Water Lilies
creator: Claude Monet
description: One of Monet's iconic water lily series, capturing the tranquility and beauty of his garden at Giverny with a graceful bridge.

title: Madame Georges Charpentier (Marguerite-Louise Lemonnier, 1848–1904) and Her Children, Georgette-Berthe (1872–1945) and Paul-Emile-Charles (1875–1895)
creator: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
description: A family portrait of Madame Charpentier and her children, painted by Renoir with a warm and intimate atmosphere.

title: The Rocky Mountains, Lander's Peak
creator: Albert Bierstadt
description: A grand and breathtaking landscape painting of the Rocky Mountains, showcasing Bierstadt’s mastery of light and scale.

title: Young Lady in 1866
creator: Gustave Courbet
description: A captivating portrait by Courbet, showcasing a young woman from the 19th century with a sense of natural elegance.

title: Old Trees, Level Distance
creator: John Constable
description: A serene landscape by Constable, capturing the timeless beauty of old trees against a distant horizon.

title: Inferno
creator: Franz von Stuck
description: A fiery and intense representation of the concept of hell, possibly inspired by Dante’s Divine Comedy.

title: Saint Jerome as Scholar
creator: Albrecht Dürer
description: A highly detailed portrait of Saint Jerome, depicted as a scholar, with Dürer's precise rendering of the figure and the scholarly environment.

title: Study of a Young Woman
creator: John Singer Sargent
description: A graceful study of a young woman, painted by Sargent with his signature fluid brushstrokes and keen attention to character.

title: The Death of Socrates
creator: Jacques-Louis David
description: A dramatic and emotionally charged scene showing Socrates’ final moments before his execution, captured with neoclassical precision.

title: Marble female figure
creator: Bastis Master
description: A classical marble sculpture representing a female figure, embodying the beauty and elegance of ancient Greek or Roman art.

title: A Woman Seated beside a Vase of Flowers (Madame Paul Valpinçon?)
creator: Élisabeth Louise Vigée Le Brun
description: A portrait of a woman seated gracefully next to a vase of flowers, painted by Vigée Le Brun with refined elegance and delicate detail.

title: The Immaculate Conception
creator: Bartolomé Esteban Murillo
description: A serene and luminous depiction of the Virgin Mary, symbolizing purity and divine grace, by Spanish artist Murillo.

title: Study for 'A Sunday on La Grande Jatte'
creator: Georges Seurat
description: A preliminary study for Seurat's famous pointillist masterpiece, showcasing his detailed planning of color and form.

title: The Bodmer Oak, Fontainebleau Forest
creator: Jean-Baptiste-Camille Corot
description: A tranquil landscape capturing the grandeur of the Bodmer Oak, located in the Fontainebleau Forest, painted by Corot.

title: The Crucifixion with Saints and a Donor
creator: Jan van Eyck
description: A richly detailed altarpiece depicting the crucifixion of Christ, surrounded by saints and a donor, painted in van Eyck’s iconic style.

title: Garden at Sainte-Adresse
creator: Claude Monet
description: A beautiful depiction of a garden in Sainte-Adresse, painted by Monet, showcasing his mastery of light and nature.

title: Circus Sideshow (Parade de cirque)
creator: Georges Seurat
description: A lively and colorful depiction of a circus parade, captured with Seurat’s signature pointillist technique.

title: The Crucifixion with the Virgin and Saint John
creator: Giovanni Bellini
description: A solemn and emotional portrayal of the crucifixion, with the Virgin Mary and Saint John the Evangelist in mourning.

title: Irises
creator: Vincent van Gogh
description: A vibrant and textured painting of irises, capturing van Gogh’s love for nature and his energetic brushstrokes.

title: Biographies of Lian Po and Lin Xiangru
creator: Huang Tingjian
description: A historical Chinese painting depicting the legendary figures Lian Po and Lin Xiangru, celebrated for their diplomatic wisdom.

title: Young Woman Seated on a Sofa
creator: Pierre-Auguste Renoir
description: A charming portrait of a young woman seated on a sofa, rendered with Renoir's trademark softness and light.

title: Gertrude Stein
creator: Pablo Picasso
description: A striking portrait of the writer Gertrude Stein, painted by Picasso during his early period, characterized by bold forms and colors.

title: The Triumph of Fame; (reverse) Impresa of the Medici Family and Arms of the Medici and Tornabuoni Families
creator: Andrea Mantegna
description: An allegorical painting depicting the triumph of fame, linked to the Medici family’s power, painted by Mantegna.

title: The Spanish Singer
creator: Diego Velázquez
description: A lively portrait of a Spanish singer, painted by Velázquez, highlighting his ability to capture human expression and detail.

title: Oedipus and the Sphinx
creator: Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres
description: A neoclassical painting depicting the myth of Oedipus and the Sphinx, showcasing Ingres' precision and mastery of form.

title: Wheat Field with Cypresses
creator: Vincent van Gogh
description: A bold and expressive landscape of a wheat field with towering cypress trees, painted by van Gogh during his time in Saint-Rémy-de-Provence.

title: Autumn Rhythm (Number 30)
creator: Jackson Pollock
description: A powerful and dynamic abstract expressionist painting by Pollock, filled with rhythmic drips and splatters of paint.

title: Hagar in the Wilderness
creator: Gustave Doré
description: A dramatic illustration by Doré of the biblical story of Hagar and her son Ishmael in the wilderness.

title: Whalers
creator: Winslow Homer
description: A vivid and action-packed scene depicting a group of whalers, showcasing Homer’s skill in capturing human emotion and movement.

title: The Last Supper
creator: Leonardo da Vinci
description: A monumental depiction of Jesus' final meal with his disciples, celebrated for its composition and emotional intensity.

title: A Hunting Scene
creator: Piero di Cosimo (Piero di Lorenzo di Piero d'Antonio)
description: A lively scene capturing the thrill of the hunt, emphasizing movement and natural surroundings.

title: The Annunciation
creator: Fra Angelico
description: A serene depiction of the angel Gabriel delivering the news to Mary, known for its grace and spiritual calm.

title: Mars and Venus United by Love
creator: Paolo Veronese
description: An allegorical painting celebrating the union of war and love through rich color and opulent composition.

title: Madonna and Child
creator: Giotto di Bondone
description: An influential depiction of the Virgin Mary holding the Christ child, pioneering realism in religious art.

title: Madonna and Child Enthroned with Saints
creator: Raphael
description: A harmonious composition placing Madonna and Child amid adoring saints, displaying Raphael’s mastery of balance.

title: The Adoration of the Shepherds
creator: Georges de La Tour
description: A candle-lit nativity scene emphasizing simplicity, devotion, and the warmth of faith.

title: Stela of the Steward Mentuwoser
creator: Egyptian artist
description: An ancient Egyptian stela commemorating Mentuwoser, rich with hieroglyphic inscriptions and symbolic carvings.

title: Madonna and Child
creator: Sandro Botticelli
description: A tender portrayal of Madonna and Child in Botticelli’s distinctively elegant and lyrical style.

title: Angels Swinging Censers
creator: Master of the St. Lucy Legend
description: Angelic figures performing rituals, delicately illustrated with late medieval flair.

title: The Musicians
creator: Caravaggio
description: A captivating work showing young men playing music, blending realism with sensual overtones.

title: Pirate Jenny
creator: John Bratby
description: A gritty, raw portrayal inspired by the character Pirate Jenny from Brecht’s ‘Threepenny Opera’.

title: Young Sailor II
creator: Henri Matisse
description: A vivid, bold portrait of a young sailor showcasing Matisse’s expressive color palette.

title: Aristotle with a Bust of Homer
creator: Rembrandt
description: Philosopher Aristotle reflects thoughtfully on Homer’s legacy, rendered with Rembrandt’s profound psychological insight.

title: Lucas van Uffel
creator: Anthony van Dyck
description: A portrait of a wealthy merchant, highlighting van Dyck’s sophisticated handling of fabrics and character.

title: Madame Cézanne (Hortense Fiquet, 1850–1922) in a Red Dress
creator: Paul Cézanne
description: A solemn yet intimate portrait of Cézanne’s wife, demonstrating his study of form and color.

title: The Baptism of Christ
creator: Piero della Francesca
description: A fresco renowned for its serene geometry and divine light, depicting John baptizing Jesus.

title: The Card Players
creator: Paul Cézanne
description: A meditative painting of peasants quietly playing cards, capturing human gravity through subtle structure.

title: The House of Bijapur
creator: Indian Mughal artist
description: A courtly painting representing one of the grandest families of Mughal India.

title: The Adoration of the Magi
creator: Gentile da Fabriano
description: A lavish and detailed depiction of the Three Kings’ journey to honor the newborn Christ.

title: The Toilette of Venus
creator: François Boucher
description: An ornate rococo masterpiece portraying Venus in an opulent and sensual setting.

title: The Abduction of the Sabine Women
creator: Nicolas Poussin
description: A classical interpretation of the legendary Roman abduction, choreographed with dynamic elegance.

title: The Death of Socrates
creator: Jacques-Louis David
description: A dramatic neoclassical painting showing Socrates’ final moments, emphasizing reason and sacrifice.

title: The Rocky Mountains, Lander's Peak
creator: Albert Bierstadt
description: An awe-inspiring landscape portraying the grandeur of the American West with luminous majesty.

title: The Spanish Singer
creator: Édouard Manet
description: A vibrant early work by Manet, mixing realism and exoticism in the figure of a Spanish guitarist.

title: Oedipus and the Sphinx
creator: Jean-Auguste-Dominique Ingres
description: An intense, enigmatic confrontation between the Greek hero and the Sphinx rendered in neoclassical style.

title: Wheat Field with Cypresses
creator: Vincent van Gogh
description: One of Van Gogh’s luminous landscapes, showcasing swirling skies and vibrant nature.

title: Autumn Rhythm (Number 30)
creator: Jackson Pollock
description: A quintessential drip painting evoking dynamic movement and raw energy through abstraction.

title: Hagar in the Wilderness
creator: Camille Corot
description: A tender portrayal of Hagar’s biblical plight, blending landscape with poignant emotion.
